title: SB 1.19.23 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 26-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chaksharunmeelitam Jena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 23rd verse of the 19th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Samagata Sarvata Eva Sarve Vedayatha Murti Dharastri Prishthe
Nehat Namutra Nakaschanarth Rite Paranugraham Atma Sheelam
The meaning of this verse is as follows.
The king said, Parikshit Maharaj is responding to the sages.
O great sages, you have all very kindly assembled here, having come from all parts of the universe.
You are all as good as supreme knowledge personified, who resides in the planet above the three worlds.
That means who resides inside.
Satyaloka.
Consequently, you are naturally inclined to do good to others.
But for this, you have no interest either in this life or in the next.
Parikshit is glorifying the great sages who assembled there in that holy place.
So, Parikshit is telling them, you have very kindly assembled here.

color of the living beings with such attributes becomes almost extinct. So, the living entities
have got their original spiritual form, have got their original effulgence, but that is
covered by the material energy, covered by the material energy. There are three planetary
systems namely the lower worlds, the intermediate worlds and the upper worlds, upper worlds.
The human beings on earth are situated at the beginning of the intermediate worlds,
but living beings like Brahma and his contemporaries live in the upper worlds of which the top
post is Satyaloka. Bhuloka, Bhuvarloka, Svarloka, this is the intermediate worlds.
then Maharloka, Janloka, Tapoloka, Satyaloka they are the upper worlds and lower worlds
are Atala, Sutala, Talatala, Mahatala, Rasatala, Patala like that seven planetary systems below
